title: 107_s1288
content: The Tennessee Valley Authority Act of 1933 is amended to change the composition, operation, and duties of the Board of Directors by replacing section 2 with new provisions regarding membership, operation, and duties of the Board. The Board of Directors of the Corporation shall consist of 14 members appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate, with 2 members each from Alabama, Georgia, Kentucky, Mississippi, North Carolina, Tennessee, and Virginia. Members must meet certain qualifications to be eligible for appointment. To be eligible for appointment to the Board of Directors of the Corporation, an individual must be a US citizen, not an employee of the Corporation, have no financial interests in certain businesses, and believe in the feasibility of the Act. Additionally, no more than 8 out of the 14 members can have the same party affiliation. The Board of Directors of the Corporation consists of 14 members, with no more than 8 members affiliated with the same political party. Members serve 4-year terms, with initial appointments staggered at 2, 3, and 4 years. Vacancies are filled for the remainder of the term, and reappointment is possible for members serving a full term. The Board of Directors of the Corporation consists of 14 members, with no more than 8 members affiliated with the same political party. Members serve 4-year terms, with initial appointments staggered at 2, 3, and 4 years. Vacancies are filled for the remainder of the term, and reappointment is possible for members serving a full term. A member appointed for a full term may be reappointed for 1 additional term. A member appointed to fill a vacancy for more than 2 years is considered to have been appointed for a full term. Eight members constitute a quorum for the Board, and a vacancy does not impair the Board's power as long as there are 8 members in office. Board members are entitled to a stipend of $30,000 per year. The Corporation's Board of Directors consists of 14 members with staggered 4-year terms. Members receive a stipend of $30,000 per year. The Chief Executive Officer is appointed by the President with Senate approval. To be the CEO of the Corporation, a person must be a US citizen, have management experience in large organizations, not be a current or recent Board member, and have no financial interest in certain businesses. The CEO of the Corporation must be a US citizen with management experience in large organizations, not a current or recent Board member, and have no financial interest in certain businesses. The CEO serves a 4-year term, with the possibility of reappointment, and receives compensation not exceeding the annual rate of pay prescribed under Level III of the Executive Schedule. The CEO of the Corporation must be a US citizen with management experience in large organizations, not a current or recent Board member, and have no financial interest in certain businesses. The CEO serves a 4-year term, with the possibility of reappointment, and receives compensation not exceeding the annual rate of pay prescribed under Level III of the Executive Schedule. A member of the board of directors of the Tennessee Valley Authority appointed before a certain date shall continue to serve until the expiration of their term and may not be reappointed. The amendments made by this Act take effect 90 days after enactment, appointing additional members to the Tennessee Valley Authority Board and CEO.
